title: [IMPORTANT] Riot Games Needs to Stop Permabanning Players For Being Toxic
body:
Riot Games should not be banning players for being toxic - instead encourage the use of the mute button rather than punish players. I have some friends that will occasionally get fed up with players who are feeding and trash talk them. They have been playing League of Legends for 5 years and they get permabanned. League of Legends is banning valuable players who have invested tons of money and hours of their lives into their game, just because they talk shit in a video game. Like Dunkey said, "what's the fun in the video game if I can't talk shit". 

On the other hand, intentional feeders who stay quiet in the chat are getting off scott-free and continue to ruin games for others. You can always mute a toxic player, but you more often than not, you cannot stop a troll from feeding if he's set on it.

I myself, got permabanned last night. I'll admit it, I get heated when I have incompetent players on my team, and I'm sure everyone does. It's just that some people decide to speak up and some people decide to stay quiet. But this isn't the first time I've been permabanned. I was permabanned 4 years ago, and I find it astonishing that the ban is for my entire life instead of extending it for a year or two years. Don't you think most people's behaviour would be changed by that (let alone all those people who will set the game aside after a year of inactivity). Unfortunately for me, I came back to realize that this was the exact same game I loved and hated so deeply. The gameplay and creativity gone into the game are incredible - really has potential to ruin someones life because of how fun it is. On the other hand, the riot games community has done so little for the actual players, and instead try to reward and benefit only competitive players. This needs to change. I spent over a thousand dollars on my account that was banned four years ago. I thought about all the time and money I'd wasted on League of Legends just to lose all of it because a singed on my team decided to intentionally feed for 20 minutes. 

Just my two cents.

TL;DR: Riot should encourage the use of the mute button and stop permabanning valued players who have invested time and money into the game - instead, focus on dealing with trolls and feeders.

Edit: Yeah I know, controversial. Understand that flamers who say things like: "I hope you die of cancer" and constantly flame are not people I'm talking about. I'm speaking on behalf of the players who are frusterated in some of their games in which they have a troll or a player sabotaging the team.

No amount of time or money spent makes it ok for you to be toxic. Muting is not an excuse either, as by the time someone is forced to mute you, you've already become a problem. Muting is to prevent further chat issues in the current match, and being punished for it is to keep you from doing it in the future.

Riot used to not ban for chat offenses; they would simply give you another chat restriction, and they would endlessly stack. This, however, was not conducive to reforming players and many would just stack up hundreds or even thousands of chat restrictions and continue being a problem because they didn't care.

If you think permabans are so harsh, wouldn't one think you'd improve your behavior before you got escalated to it? Couldn't be too bad if you ignored the threat of it.

It's only understandable to be upset if your team was cheated of a victory, which you spent 20-60 minutes of your time trying to win: in which case, one of the players on your team is intentionally feeding or trolling. It's NOT understandable if there is a player on your team screaming: "I hope you die of cancer" every 5 seconds. Those players deserve permabans - but we need to draw the line. Not all players who are toxic should be thrown in the same pile.

> Not all players who are toxic should be thrown in the same pile.

And they aren't. It takes a *lot* to actually ever get punished. You must be consistently toxic to ever get punished just once for minor offenses, and you have to work through multiple tiers of punishment to even get banned for it. Severe offenses can skip past the tiers to a ban immediately.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions

Flamers and people who speak up about allies bad plays are still valued league of legends players, and permanent chat restriction ensures that there is no more toxicity.

RITO did this thing a long time ago and about 90% of the people perma chat banned started to troll because they couldn't flame.
Okay? So then ban them. I've been fighting for TROLLS to get banned. I'm talking about the ones who will cease to flame because they can't, so they will continue playing without sabotaging teammates.

Why give them that chance?

If they've already shown to be incapable of controlling themselves, it's already likely that they'll troll once they're chat banned.

Detecting and catching trolling is infinitely more difficult, especially if they're trying to avoid detection.

Not only would they still show poor behavior, but it becomes harder to remove them with proof.

Which is easier for a computer to detect, inappropriate language or inappropriate actions? Language, by far, so Riot's first pass at an automated player behavior system uses that. It's Behavior counterpart lags behind it by quite a bit, but you still see people come to these boards banned by it from time to time.

It's *easy* to not flame in chat. It's so *incredibly* easy to avoid ever getting a chat restriction (let alone a permaban), it's not even funny. You can even give criticism and feedback freely, you just have to be mature about how you do it.

I actually agree with a lot of the points you brought up. My concern is with the idea of permanently banning a player. Wouldn't it be better to test the player with a year long ban, two year long ban, etc. After another long ban, they will eventually learn. But after a 300 year long ban? Where is the learning curve if 14 day ban isn't enough. It's very obvious to me that this is not a popular matter - or a topic in which people can speak freely on without getting bashed, but I'm sure people that have been permabanned before: with an account they have spent years of their time and (perhaps) thousands of dollars on, will understand where I'm coming from.

From what I've observed, the general problem with the punishment system is that people don't take it seriously enough when the warnings *start* to come in. 

Tell me if this sounds familiar, either for your case or your friends:

* People think that the 10 game chat restriction was a mistake
* They then think the 25 game chat restriction was a joke/whatever punishment, and that they're still fine.
* They get the wake up call with the 2-week ban, and try to change
* Despite making steps to improve after the 2-week ban, they still fall into old habits at one point or another and get permabanned

I think if the 10 and 25 game chat restrictions were taken more seriously (perhaps a warning that "the behavior that lead to this punishment **will** get you permabanned if continued"), they'd start reforming earlier and be able to avoid the permaban.

The problem with bans is it goes based off number of reports, I got a 14 day ban cuz told team in select I was muting them to protect my self from raging out, they reported me sending me into threshold of ban status.

Reports flag matches for review and trigger a review when you have received too many in too few games. If you did not do anything wrong then the report will be thrown out. You are not punished based on report volume, but on your behavior in the reported matches.

If you believe your punishment to be an error then I recommend posting the chat logs you received. We would be happy to look over them and help determine what negative behavior may have resulted in the punishment. If the punishment was an error then you can submit a ticket for a manual review to have it removed.

Also, if you received a 14 day ban this would've come after multiple prior punishments or the offenses were severe enough to warrant the escalation. There are [4 tiers of punishment](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Boqd81O0-upcoming-upgrades-to-chat-restrictions) to go through, with a 14 day ban being the third.
Where would I submit those to? As definitely feel was a bit harsh based on the chat logs given from the ban

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

You can always find it by clicking "Support" on the top of this page, logging into the support site, then selecting "Submit a Request".

Reviews are triggered based off the number of reported games, not off the number of reports. Being reported 9x on the same game means you only got reported on 1 game, and is the same as if you were reported only 1 time that game.
